answers.answer: TSH is often used as a screening test for thyroid problems.  Your doctor might suspect a thyroid issue.  The problem is that TSH often comes back "normal" when there is a problem.  The old reference range for TSH was 0.5-5.0.  The currently accepted one is 0.3-3.0.  Many labs and doctors are still using the old range, leaving their patients with thyroid symptoms.  If your husband's TSH comes back anywhere near the top or bottom of the 0.3-3.0 range, he should have further thyroid testing...free T3 (FT3) and free T4 (FT4).  These give a much better indication of thyroid status.
